content.description: This hidden crack boulder problem starts from the floor of the cave below the boulders. Finger lock and achieve high feet. Utilize the nodes in the crack for bomber feet and hands. Exit the crack left to the saddle in the left wall to make it more interesting than exiting right following the crack.Nice warmup in the shade.The nodes in the crack would also be good for Trad beginners to practice and visually inspect placements with nuts and cams.Video Beta: youtu.be/sLD6Ngqax6A

Hide Your Crack boulder is east of the Spite Your Face wall and slab.The 14' crack climb is hidden from view from any trail and can only be seen from atop other boulders or if you crawl under a boulder through a tunnel. If you see a large sharp boulder west of and resting upon a red granite slab boulder Hide The Crack is just east of it down below. Climbing up this pile of boulders and looking down will make it obvious whereas hiking to the east and looking uphill is not as obvious. This climb should be out of the sun most of the day.Video Beta: youtu.be/sLD6Ngqax6A
